sources.title: Strange People (1933)
sources.description: There was hiss in the audio of the first version of this film that was uploaded to the Archive.  I removed most of it with Audacity.

sources.title: Strange People
sources.description: “Good script hindered by an almost anonymous cast” “The jury is out…to be murdered!” (IMBD reviews quotes). An old dark house thriller in which the twelve members of a jury that condemned a man to death are lured to an isolated mansion. More deaths follow. Large ensemble cast. Good production values for a second feature. IMDB rating 6.9. Directed by Richard Thorpe. Released in 1933. Three minutes are missing. TRIVIA: First US telecast was on September 15, 1952 by KRON channel 4 Los Angeles.

metadata.Plot: All 12 jury members who sent an innocent man to the gallows are gathered together for a demonstration of how convictions can be made on circumstantial evidence. During the proceedings, a phony murder is quickly revealed as the real thing.
metadata.Actors: John Darrow, Gloria Shea, Hale Hamilton
